question: Which country has launched its ‘Flash Flood Guidance’ system to provide forecasting services to South-Asian countries?
explanation:
India has launched ‘Flash Flood Guidance’ services for itself and other South Asian countries including Bangladesh, Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, to provide impact-based forecasting.
The Flash Flood Guidance system has been designed by the India Meteorological Department (IMD), to provide forecasting of flash floods which occur at short duration. The services are provided at watershed and city level.
